Hi Maha, 

 

We are assuming the below related to insurance and the limits has been confirmed by Hagop and the team as sufficient? and you are OK with the Appendix B?

 

In respect to the agreement, the language related to penalties should be deleted (Clause 10). We should have a pro-rata refund of fees paid up to the point of termination in the event of early termination, especially because we are paying a portion in advance (Clause 8). For fees and expenses, we are assuming these amounts and terms are confirmed by finance, but we suggest including an invoicing period such as NET30 or NET45 (Clause 5).

In respect to the agreement, the language related to penalties should be deleted (Clause 10). We should have a pro-rata refund of fees paid up to the point of termination in the event of early termination, especially because we are paying a portion in advance (Clause 8). For fees and expenses, we are assuming these amounts and terms are confirmed by finance, but we suggest including an invoicing period such as NET30 or NET45 (Clause 5). 

 

Additionally, we suggest having a short IP clause stating that “any use of Client’s logo, tradename, or intellectual property rights, as well as any public announcement, requires prior written consent” and that “Service Provider will hold the requisite licenses, registrations and approvals, comply with all applicable laws and regulations, and provide services with a high level of skill and diligence”

 

Let us know your / their feedback.

 

Best, 

Dana 

 

DANA MAHDI​​​​

M.C.T. FZE

DUBAI
